Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2008 06:00AM lLinda wrote: HI JADWIGA, I HAVE  HAD TO BE ON CHEMO NAVELBINE FOR QUITE SOMETIME AND IT STOPPED WORKING AND I WAS OFF OF IT A YEAR, WHEN THE XELODA DID NOT WORK AND THE HERCEPTIN SEEM TO BE NOT WORKING--OH YES, TOOK A TURN AT TAXOTERE, WE WENT BACK TO NAVELBINE , NOW WITH TYKERB, SINCE SEPTEMBER THE BREAST CANCER OF THE SKIN AROUND MY NECK IS QUITE FAINT NOW, SO I THINK THAT THE BODY DOES DIFFERENT THINGS AT DIFFERENT TIMES.  I THINK WE GOT NOTHING TO LOOSE EITHER TO TRY FOR EVERYTHING. GOOD LUCK AND HANG IN THERE!!! LINDA C
Posts.Title: taking the same chemo twice jadwiga LoriFL

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2009 02:23AM lLinda wrote: Hi Ladies, I have had 6 occurrences of breast cancer--my Dr. says he has not seen a case like mine.  I have been blessed-- only small episodes of being sick(had pnuemonia in 1999) no major complications along the way. (I guess with 6 occurrences my plate is already full(lol)  I had been off chemo from 1999 til 2002, and it came back and I was on chemo for 6 years til Dec. 2008,  I have been off chemo for 9 months, well now (breast cancer cells are in my lymph glands(the ones near your ears) and I will start Herceptin and Navelbine again on Monday.  Frustrating, yeah, but I am not ready to give up--Nov. 17, 2009 I will be a 11 year Survivor---With Gods Blessings--I Am There!!!  I Believe that all things are possible--I Love Living. One day I told my son I felt warm, he ask, Mom are you running a temp, I ask why do I have to be running a temp---he said, "You don't know you have cancer", so do you know about a temp? It was a great laugh for both of us, he says "no one would ever know that you are sick"--I am grateful for this.  OK ladies--hang in here for all you are worth--I block out statistics---they are worrisome numbers for me---this is my safety valve--Just Live!   My surgeon said, Linda, we will live til we die!! Linda C.

Posts.Title: Anyone 10 or 20 year surviror at this Stage TLF Padiddle

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2009 07:13PM - edited Feb 24, 2009 07:28PM by lLinda Hi Eric, You Love your wife is the 1st start!!!! I am a 10 yr survivor---with the support of, my husband of 43 years.  He tells me I am his "sunshine everyday".  I feel Loved!!! He has been at all surgeries, every chemo, and radiation when he could, do to work schedules. We are retired now, just trying to still enjoy life and be happy. He helps with every thing  to keep house, laundry--we are a team and I never forget to tell him how I appreciate him.  He has made me feel like a like a lady, when I felt like "Not".  We talked alot about the Cancer in the earlier times---he knows --"the cancer will have to catch me running'--so I act like so!!!  So it is how we roll--everyday I wake is special to me to be here and he knows that--I have listened to his fears---most peope hear Cancer and think Death--people have to feel what they feel---he says ,he goes by what and how I am, and I have been blessed to be stong by this, and I feel so has he.  I have my "cancer days", I may cry or just be sad, but I let him know this is what it is(because you can't run past these feelings either) It is a heavy situation, but you can get through it--together--just be sure to share what you are feeling and let her tell you what she is feeling--it has to come out or it comes out in other ways--Anger, headaches, ect. Take Care and hang in there!!!  Linda C.

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2008 01:17AM lLinda wrote: HI FLORIDA, I AM A LIL LATE WITH MY COMMENTS, BUT HOPE TO HELP!!!  IT IS ALMOST A GIVEN WHEN WE SAY WE HAVE BREAST CANCER FOR PEOPLES EYES TO AUTOMATICALLY TO GO TO OUR CHEST--I GUESS AFTER 6 YEARS I AM USE OF IT--HOWEVER FOR LADIES THAT ARE JUST HAVING SURGERY, THERE IS A SOFTIE BRA, WHERE THE MASTECTOMY PRODUCTS ARE SOLD( AND I DON'T UNDERSTAND WHY THEY DON'T TELL THE LADIES ABOUT THIS) IT HAS NYLON IN IT, SO THAT YOU CAN FIT YOUR  SIZE, AND AT LEAST ALMOST FEEL HUMAN AS FAR AS LOOKS--IT WAS COVERED BY MY INSURANCE--IT WAS 80.00 BACK THEN, I DID NOT KNOW ABOUT IT WHEN I HAD MY RIGHT BREAST REMOVED, THEN 3 WEEKS LATER THE LEFT BREAST, I WORE IT HOME FROM THE HOSPITAL AND UNTIL I WAS FITTED FOR MY PROSTHESIS.  THIS REALLY DID HELP MY ATTITUDE TOO. GOOD LUCK AND TAKE CARE. LINDA C
Posts.Title: Tryuing to be brave floridasurvivor47 Fitztwins

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2009 02:49AM lLinda wrote: Hi Ladies, I am on Herceptin and Navalebine. I am so afraid of Flu shots--so afraid, I figured I will die from one--so my Asthma Dr. said if I felt this way, to not get one.  My Onc and I go round and round each year about that Flu shot, he thinks I should have one---I am just scared!!  So I "arm my self" with "Deep Immune" supplements, I have had some ugly colds ( they don't last long, 3 days, Thank God)--I did have Pneumonia in 1999, but it did not require hospitalization--I was on Adramycin and Cytoxyan at that time.(This was before CA, I did have "The Philippine Flu in 1985 that turned in to Pneumonia and spent a week in the hospital, I mean I was SICK!!!  I been Blessed not to have caught "bugs", as during the past years I always worked in a hospital and during some of those years, I was on one Chemo or another. Good luck to every one with your choices, I certainly believe to do what you think is necessary for yourself. Linda C.
Posts.Title: H1N1 Poll--ALL STAGES WELCOME! badboob67 wildgardener

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2008 08:40PM - edited Feb 9, 2008 08:41PM by lLinda HELLO KATHLEEN, I FINISHED TAXOTERE JUNE 2007---IT WAS NOT BAD FOR THE EXCEPTION I LOST MY HAIR, BUT IT GREW BACK.  IT SEEMS AFTER THE STEROID THAT THEY GAVE WORE OFF, I WAS A LIL ACHY NOTHING MOTRIN  COULD NOT CLEAR UP---THE TIREDNESS IS THERE, JUST REST WHEN YOU CAN, BE GOOD TO YOURSELF---IT SEEMS LIKE SOME LONG DAYS FOR THE LENGTH OF TREATMENT, BUT YOU WILL MAKE IT.   I SEE YOU ARE ON TAXOTERE/CYTOXAN, I HAD THE ADRAMYACIN AND CYTOXAN--TOOK OFF FOR CHEMO DAYS AND WENT TO WORK FOR 8 HR. JOB--I DON'T ADVISE THIS, BUT IT KEPT ME FROM THINKING ABOUT "ME" TOO MUCH--IT HELPED!!!! BEST OF LUCK TO YOU

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2011 06:24PM lLinda wrote: Hi Ladies, I am a 12 1/2 yr survivor. 15andmore---Congratulations---Please tell your story!!!! This is a short version of my journey with only a few details.  I hope it will also give someone hope. I started out with a lumpectomy in Nov. 1998.  In 2002 I had to have a Mastectomy, one within 3 weeks of the other one . The situation just seem to snowball from there--to my chest walls, under my right arm and last episode 2009 in my lymph nodes under my jaws--the Herceptin and Navelbine seem to check that, so we are doing maintenance with Herceptin for now.  I have had six occurrences of BC in these years.  I have been on 8 different kinds of chemo.  In the past 9 years, for the exception of 9 months 2008, when my Dr. and I decided to do nothing and take a break, I had been on one Chemo or the other, every week, and when I went to chemo pills, every day.  I have been very Blessed not too have "bad side effects"(have had to get off a couple(Xeloda and Tykerb) as they were not right for me) and to be able to still be going.  My history of this, feels long--my journey with many twists and turns.  It will have to catch me running as I will not lay down to it!!  Right now I am on Herceptin every 3 weeks, have been off of Navelbine for 8 weeks to help give the nueropthy  a rest. Breast Cancer can be a "chronic disease" and sometimes we have to stay on the meds to live, and for me, when I have looked at it this way, it helps.  I am thankful for all the new meds that are out there, and on the way.  No I do not like having to live this way--I won't complain--as" I am here" to support any one on this journey, and say, "don't give up"--you may have ca, it does not have you!! Everyone, hang in there!!  I use not to want to tell the new people that I have had this kind of journey, as I thought "how scary", that must be to hear--yeah it is--but just know you can make it, as there are people who have----- and will. Thanks for letting me share. Linda C.
